description: Lists the tasks in a maintenance window.

parameters.name: WindowId
parameters.description: The ID of the maintenance window whose tasks should be retrieved.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: Optional filters used to narrow down the scope of the returned tasks. The supported filter keys are WindowTaskId, TaskArn, Priority, and TaskType. (dict) --- Filter used in the request. Supported filter keys depend on the API operation that includes the filter. API operations that use MaintenanceWindowFilter> include the following: DescribeMaintenanceWindowExecutions DescribeMaintenanceWindowExecutionTaskInvocations DescribeMaintenanceWindowExecutionTasks DescribeMaintenanceWindows DescribeMaintenanceWindowTargets DescribeMaintenanceWindowTasks Key (string) --- The name of the filter. Values (list) --- The filter values. (string) ---

nested_items.name: Tasks
nested_items.description: Information about the tasks in the maintenance window.

nested_items.name: WindowId
nested_items.description: The ID of the maintenance window where the task is registered.

nested_items.name: WindowTaskId
nested_items.description: The task ID.

nested_items.name: TaskArn
nested_items.description: The resource that the task uses during execution. For RUN_COMMAND and AUTOMATION task types, TaskArn is the Amazon Web Services Systems Manager (SSM document) name or ARN. For LAMBDA tasks, it's the function name or ARN. For STEP_FUNCTIONS tasks, it's the state machine ARN.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of task.

nested_items.name: Targets
nested_items.description: The targets (either managed nodes or tags). Managed nodes are specified using Key=instanceids,Values=<instanceid1>,<instanceid2>. Tags are specified using Key=<tag name>,Values=<tag value>.
Key=tag-key,Values=tag-value-1,tag-value-2

nested_items.name: TaskParameters
nested_items.description: The parameters that should be passed to the task when it is run.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: This field contains an array of 0 or more strings, each 1 to 255 characters in length.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Priority
nested_items.description: The priority of the task in the maintenance window. The lower the number, the higher the priority. Tasks that have the same priority are scheduled in parallel.

nested_items.name: LoggingInfo
nested_items.description: Information about an S3 bucket to write task-level logs to.

nested_items.name: S3BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of an S3 bucket where execution logs are stored.

nested_items.name: S3KeyPrefix
nested_items.description: (Optional) The S3 bucket subfolder.

nested_items.name: S3Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region where the S3 bucket is located.

nested_items.name: ServiceRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM service role for Amazon Web Services Systems Manager to assume when running a maintenance window task. If you do not specify a service role ARN, Systems Manager uses a service-linked role in your account. If no appropriate service-linked role for Systems Manager exists in your account, it is created when you run RegisterTaskWithMaintenanceWindow.

nested_items.name: MaxConcurrency
nested_items.description: The maximum number of targets this task can be run for, in parallel.

nested_items.name: MaxErrors
nested_items.description: The maximum number of errors allowed before this task stops being scheduled.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The task name.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the task.

nested_items.name: CutoffBehavior
nested_items.description: The specification for whether tasks should continue to run after the cutoff time specified in the maintenance windows is reached.

nested_items.name: AlarmConfiguration
nested_items.description: The details for the CloudWatch alarm applied to your maintenance window task.

nested_items.name: IgnorePollAlarmFailure
nested_items.description: When this value is true, your automation or command continues to run in cases where we can't retrieve alarm status information from CloudWatch. In cases where we successfully retrieve an alarm status of OK or INSUFFICIENT_DATA, the automation or command continues to run, regardless of this value. Default is false.

nested_items.name: Alarms
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch alarm specified in the configuration.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of your CloudWatch alarm.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to use when requesting the next set of items. If there are no additional items to return, the string is empty.
